definition: to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: These improved economic conditions are all helping to boost confidence.
sentences.chinese: 这些好转的经济环境对提振信心百益而无一害。

sentences.english: Would it be better or worse?
Business is fairly slow; we're just marking time till the economy improves.
sentences.chinese: 现在生意相当萧条，我们正等待经济的好转。

sentences.english: The patient gained ground after being on operation.
But doctors, thinking McKinley was improving, never used it.
sentences.chinese: 但医生认为麦金莱已经好转，并没有使用X光机。

sentences.english: It is not going to turn around the sickest areas of the nation’s economy.
sentences.chinese: 这项协议不会使美国经济中最糟糕的领域出现好转。

sentences.english: The sick child is gaining and will soon be well.
sentences.chinese: 病孩正在好转，并将很快恢复健康。

sentences.english: She didn't get better, and her palms started itching.
sentences.chinese: 她没有好转并且她的手掌开始发痒。

sentences.english: And the gut-wrenching crash in European equities has reversed itself a bit in recent days.
sentences.chinese: 而且欧洲股市惨痛暴跌的情况近来也渐渐好转。

sentences.english: Difference of cationic silk market improved, sold steadily increasing.
sentences.chinese: 差别化的阳离子丝市场行情好转，成交价稳中有升。

sentences.english: After this gruesome tale the easing of the siege comes as an anticlimax.
sentences.chinese: 在这令人毛骨悚然的故事之后，保卫战形势突然好转。

sentences.english: In addition, the summer sun also make acne better.
sentences.chinese: 另外，夏天的阳光也会让痘痘好转。

sentences.english: They moved her upstairs where she continued to improve.
sentences.chinese: 他们把她搬到了楼上，在那里，她的情况继续好转。

sentences.english: The newly released US economic data does not bode well though.
sentences.chinese: 尽管最新公布的美国经济数据仍未见好转。

sentences.english: I expect to refloat when weather improves.
sentences.chinese: 我船预计在天气好转时能重新浮起。

sentences.english: Sindu softened a bit and wiped her tears with the back of her hands.
sentences.chinese: 女儿的样子稍微好转了一点，用小手背擦了擦眼泪。

definition: improvement/turnaround (for the better)
a turn for the better/to pick up/to improve
to worsen
change of appearance/to revise one's point of view
to weaken/to fall off
to get better/to improve/to get well
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
(of the weather) to warm up again
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
sometimes good, sometimes bad
to recover completely (from illness or injury)
to wane/to vanish gradually
to reinstate/to resume/to restore/to recover/to regain/to rehabilitate
to bring relief/to alleviate (a crisis)/to dull (a pain)
mark/indication/sign/indicator
somewhat/to some extent
